text.text:
The jewel-shaped dome culminating with star-like apex symbolize unity and act of transition between Allah and his faithful servants. The multi-painted star tinted glass roof symbolize openness. The six minarets symbolize the six tenets of Iman. One of the tallest minarets, stylized from the concept of a jewel-shaped dome culminating with the star and crescent signifies concentration, openness and victory, as well as sovereignty and divinity. It also provides a high point from which to summon the faithful for congregational prayer and is lighted at night and highlights the elevated crescent and star.

The building comprises a basement car park, 18 classrooms, auditorium for 130 people, a computer room and a lift serving all floors.

The mosque is accessible from Bangkit LRT station and nearby bus stops that operate bus numbers 922, 920 and 976.

It also provides a high point from which to summon the faithful for congregational prayer and is lighted at night and highlights the elevated crescent and star.

The building comprises a basement car park, 18 classrooms, auditorium for 130 people, a computer room and a lift serving all floors.

text.text: Serving the muslim community in Bt. Panjang & surrounding areas since 2003. Big spacious prayer hall with modern ammenities. Constant upgrading & upkeep have kept the mosque in good condition. Bangkit LRT Station is the nearest to the mosque. Public carpark available opposite the mosque.

originalText.text: Serving the muslim community in Bt. Panjang & surrounding areas since 2003. Big spacious prayer hall with modern ammenities. Constant upgrading & upkeep have kept the mosque in good condition. Bangkit LRT Station is the nearest to the mosque. Public carpark available opposite the mosque.

text.text: Al-Iman Mosque is Bukit Panjang's gem for the Muslim community to go for their daily and Friday Prayers. It is also a venue for the community to come together for lectures or syarahan and Islamic education. The mosque is served by Bukit Panjang LRT at BP9 Bangkit.

originalText.text: Al-Iman Mosque is Bukit Panjang's gem for the Muslim community to go for their daily and Friday Prayers. It is also a venue for the community to come together for lectures or syarahan and Islamic education. The mosque is served by Bukit Panjang LRT at BP9 Bangkit.

text.text: Bismillahi Masya Allah. The most friendliest, loveliest neighbourhood mosque. A place of peace and tranquility. Best place to do self-reflection , prayer and meditation , and cleansing of the soul to keep you closer to Allah and mend your relationship with Him.

originalText.text: Bismillahi Masya Allah. The most friendliest, loveliest neighbourhood mosque. A place of peace and tranquility. Best place to do self-reflection , prayer and meditation , and cleansing of the soul to keep you closer to Allah and mend your relationship with Him.
